title: Activities from Early Spring! Honey Strawberry and Garlic Harvest | American Bresse | Drying Herbs

tasks.task: Inspecting and potentially harvesting honey from bee colonies
subtasks: Checking on the health and activity of the bee swarm
Preparing deep and medium frames for potential honey harvesting
Monitoring the bees to determine if full frames or just samples should be taken
Preparing to crush and taste the honey harvested from the live colony

tasks.task: Harvesting and selecting ripe strawberries from the garden
subtasks: Identifying ripe strawberries and educating children on selection criteria
Assisting children in proper strawberry harvesting techniques
Demonstrating proper strawberry consumption and interaction with others

tasks.task: Evaluating and harvesting garlic crops early
subtasks: Assessing garlic growth affected by previous winter conditions
Hand-pulling garlic heads based on size and maturity
Collecting and preparing garlic to be dried

tasks.task: Layering garlic and onions for drying
subtasks: Separating garlic and onions for drying process
Proper placement of crops to ensure even drying under sun
Supervising the drying process and protecting from potential damage

tasks.task: Managing guinea pig and chicken habitats
subtasks: Observing the guinea pig's interest in bunnies and adjusting outdoor space
Providing a larger outdoor cage for the guinea pig (Champ) with adequate shelter options
Monitor the American breast chickens' hen to rooster ratio in the chicken tractor setup

tasks.task: Preparing to dry herbs for teas and medicines
subtasks: Properly using a chicken tractor (apparently used here for drying) to dry herbs
Ensuring herbs are dried sufficiently before storage
